intro: Massula angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf massula, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. Its fruits are small berries that contain several seeds. The plant is often found in shaded, moist habitats such as forests and stream sides.
